intro: Mesanthemum prescottianum, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its fleshy leaves help store water, making it well-suited for survival in harsh climates.
